ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Developed knowledge about working in a lab, carrying out different scientific protocols, thinking critically, problem-solving, reading and discussing scientific papers
This is a great course! Working with a mentor and doing research is by far the best learning applications of all MCDB courses.
I learned more about the process of scientific writing and research.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: students have the independence and freedom to work on their senior research projects and collaborate with their research mentors

Weakness: It would be helpful for all students to receive feedback on their oral presentations or other work from MCDB faculty

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Highly recommend MCDB 486 to those who wish to conduct research in their senior year. It is the culmination of your work at Yale and it is very rewarding to see your project come together in the end
